newsitem.title: GERMANY: MG to move metals trade to London, NY; plans purchase.
newsitem.headline: MG to move metals trade to London, NY; plans purchase.

text.p: Metallgesellschaft Handel & Beteiligungen AG (MG Handel), the trading unit of Germany's Metallgesellschaft AG, said Wednesday it plans to concentrate its physical metal trading operations in London and New York.
The operations, previously incorporated in MG Metal & Commodity GmbH, will now be under the control of MG Metal & Commodity Group.
The move may entail the relocation of some 56 jobs now based in Frankfurt, Germany. The company said discussions have been started to work out a social compensation package for affected workers.
MG also said that as part of the growth of its trading operations MG Metal & Commodity plans to acquire the copper trading business and certain assets of New York-based Cerro Sales Corp. in May.
The parties have agreed not to disclose the price of the transaction, MG Handel said in a statement.
Cerro Sales is a member of the Marmon Group and is active in the international trading and marketing of non-ferrous metals, predominantly copper. It has a regional focus in North and South America.
MG Handel spokesman Gerolf Werning said most of its metals trading business is located outside Germany so the move fits in with company strategy.
Trading in chemical products like sulphur and industrial chemicals will remain in Frankfurt and Paris, he said.
